    • Method Detail

      • initializeWorld

        public void initializeWorld()
        initializes resources for the game. The initialize() method is called from here which allows users an opportunity to initialize the tilegrid if the tilegrid is not set, a default one is provided all other grids are instantiated after.
        Overrides:
        initializeWorld in class BaseCode

      • setConsole

        public void setConsole(java.lang.String[] strings)
        set the text console strings Only the first 10 strings will be used

      • showConsole

        public void showConsole()
        Shows the text console

      • hideConsole

        public void hideConsole()
        Hides the text console

      • toggleConsoleVisibiltiy

        public void toggleConsoleVisibiltiy()
        toggles visibility for text console on and off

      • getCorruptedGrid

        public GridElement[][] getCorruptedGrid()
        gets the corruptedgrid
        Returns:
        2D array from the corruptedGrid (same dimensions as tileGrid)

      • getTileGrid

        public GridElement[][] getTileGrid()
        gets the tilegrid
        Returns:
        2D array from the tilegrid

      • getVirusGrid

        public GridElement[][] getVirusGrid()
        gets the virusgrid
        Returns:
        2D array from the virusGrid (same dimensions as tileGrid)

      • getRepairGrid

        public GridElement[][] getRepairGrid()
        gets the repairgrid
        Returns:
        2D array from the repairGrid (same dimensions as tileGrid)

      • setTileColumn

        public void setTileColumn(GridElement[] tline,
                          int hPosition)
        This method puts a user provided Tile column into the grid at a certain horizontal position. If hPosition exceeds existing bounds or the length of the array is incorrect, it will fail out. If there is already existing data in this column, it is overwritten.
        Parameters:
        tline - array of GridElements to add
        hPosition - horizontal position to add the column

      • getTileColumn

        public GridElement[] getTileColumn(int hPosition)
        gets a 1D GridElement array from the tileGrid based on a column position
        Parameters:
        hPosition - horizontal column position
        Returns:
        a 1D GridElement array containing the desired Column

      • setTileGrid

        public void setTileGrid(GridElement[][] tgrid)
        Sets the tileGrid using a player provided 2D GridElement array. The length of the outer array becomes the gridWidth The length of the inner arrays becomes the gridHeight If the array is jagged (inconsistent inner array lengths), a default gridHeight of 25 is provided if no array is provided or the array has invalid size in either dimension, a default 25x10 grid is provided
        Parameters:
        tgrid - player provided grid

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        gets the gridWidth. if called before grids were initialized, they will be forced to initialize with default values
        Returns:
        width of the grids (all grids should be the same dimensions)

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        gets the gridHeight. if called before grids were initialized, they will be forced to initialize with default values
        Returns:
        height of the grids (all grids should be the same dimensions)

      • updateWorld

        public void updateWorld()
        Game update loop This calls the update() method which provides the user code to implement their own logic after update() GridElement positions are verified and forced to match their 2D array grid indexes
        Overrides:
        updateWorld in class BaseCode

      • update

        public void update()
        Users can Override this method with their own update logic. This method is called each frame. in this method, they can use keyboard or mouse events to trigger 2D array manipulation and other desired game logic.

      • runLayerUpdateSequence

        public void runLayerUpdateSequence()
        This method updates the Virus and repair layers with the canned corruption logic (corruptions and tiles are have no active actions)

      • shiftGridsDown

        public void shiftGridsDown()
        shifts down each of the game grids

      • syncPositions

        public void syncPositions()
        this method checks the position of all GridElements in each layer and if the primitive positions are not in the correct place (grid index representation), it moves them to the correct place and spawns a movement particle.

      • deleteAllMarked

        public void deleteAllMarked()
        deletes all marked tiles

      • generatePlayerTile

        public Tile generatePlayerTile()
        Creates a tile based on the player location color. The center of the returned tile will be set to the player's current location
        Returns:
        Tile generated by player.

      • getPlayerPosition

        public IntVector getPlayerPosition()
        gets the location of the player
        Returns:
        IntVector representing the player's location

      • getPlayerHeight

        public int getPlayerHeight()
        gets the height of the player
        Returns:
        the height of the player as an int.

      • setPlayerHeight

        public void setPlayerHeight(int pos)
        sets the player's height position to pos. If pos is greater or equal to the game's set height, it is set to height-1. if pos is less than 0, it is set to 0.
        Parameters:
        pos - height position to set the player

      • getPlayerColorEnum

        public GridElement.ColorEnum getPlayerColorEnum()
        gets the current color of the player
        Returns:
        ColorEnum representing the color of the player

      • setPlayerColorEnum

        public void setPlayerColorEnum(GridElement.ColorEnum col)
        sets the color of the player
        Parameters:
        col - ColorEnum to set the player

      • setPlayerLaserInfiniteDrawingMode

        public void setPlayerLaserInfiniteDrawingMode(boolean mode)
        Sets the targeting laser mode for the player (this affects drawing only). InfiniteLaserMode true: laser will draw to the end of the screen if there is a clear path. InfiniteLaserMode false: laser will stop on the last column that has tiles on it
        Parameters:
        mode - if true, InfiniteLasermode will be on.

      • setPlayerVisibility

        public void setPlayerVisibility(boolean visible)
        Sets the visibility of the player cannon. Some games may not want to use the cannon functionality.
        Parameters:
        visible - if true, the player will be drawn. If false, the player will be invisible

      • movePlayerUp

        public void movePlayerUp()
        moves the player up one position

      • movePlayerDown

        public void movePlayerDown()
        moves the player down one position

      • getMouseCenter

        public IntVector getMouseCenter()
        gets the mouse position and translates it into world coordinates
        Returns:
        IntVector containing mouse position

      • playBackgroundMusic

        public void playBackgroundMusic()
        Plays the background music

      • stopBackgroundMusic

        public void stopBackgroundMusic()

      • triggerSound

        public void triggerSound(Game.Sounds key)
        trigger a given sound
        Parameters:
        key - sound to be triggered

        Overrides:
